snippet: The Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller index, which seemed to show a recovery in home prices in 2009, descended to a new depths in 2011.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column elaborates on reports indicating that US home prices fell to new lows in 2011, scuttling recovery that seemed to begin in 2009; notes that despite decline, some markets such as California and Phoenix that were hit hardest by speculation have begun to recover.
lead_paragraph: The Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller index, which seemed to show a recovery in home prices in 2009, descended to a new depths in 2011.

headline.print_headline: Home Prices Declined to New Lows in 2011
headline.seo: Home Prices Declined to New Lows in 2011
headline.main: Home Prices Declined to New Lows in 2011
